results.headline: American in Paris, An
results.summary_short: Gene Kelly just can't get enough of France in Vincente Minnelli's musical. Kelly's character, a young painter from the United States who lives above a sidewalk cafe, finds himself involved with two women: the young Leslie Caron and the sophiscated Nina Foch, who wants to be his patron and probably more. But who needs a plot? Kelly's and Caron's dance numbers, the scenery and that gorgeous Gershwin music are enough.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of An American in Paris
